newsitem.title: MEXICO: Pepsi-Gemex note to pay down debt - Abaco.
newsitem.headline: Pepsi-Gemex note to pay down debt - Abaco.

text.p: A $160 million debt issue from Pepsi-Gemex, S.A., placed last week, will help the company pay down debt and reduce average interest rates, Mexican brokerage Abaco said in a report released on Wednesday.
Pepsi-Gemex will use the proceeds of the issue to pay down outstanding debt, particularly its $110 million Eurobond issue, which expires in July.
The company will use the remainder to restructure its short-term debt to longer terms and to acquire a Pepsi-Cola franchise from Embotelladora Agral, Abaco said.

"These adjustments will allow Gemex to reduce the average interest rate on its debt from 12.0 percent to approximately 9.0 percent," the report said. "However, the company's total debt will increase by $50 million, from $206 million to $256 million."
Pepsi-Gemex is one of the largest Pepsi bottlers outside of the United States. In mid-March it changed its name from Grupo Embotellador de Mexico, S.A. to Pepsi-Gemex.
